result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Phillips

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Motion Hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 7-7-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 6-27-2022
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE TO MOTION TO SUPPRESS

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Michael Anthony Phillips not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD.  Defense is requesting a Motion hearing date.  The court provided deadlines for filing the state's response by the end of business on 7/12/22.  The Court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 16 in person.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 04/28/2022, Br 16.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Nickolas Gallert.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #18CF4440.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Copeland by email. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Michael Anthony Phillips in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Anthony Phillips
Current: 8626 W Fiebrantz Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 02-12-2022)
Prior: 2212 North 49th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
